Description: Bronze figure of Osiris, mummiform, hands crossed on breast, one holding crook, wearing atef-crown, facial features incised and originally inlaid with lapis lazuli, only fragments of which now survive, traces of gilding also survive on the neck and face, extensively corroded.
Bibliographic references: McArthur et al 2015 / The conservation and technical investigation of a hollow-cast Egyptian bronze (p.111-120, p.112, fig.1, p.113, fig.2, p.114, fig.3, fig.4a, p.115, fig.5, p.116, fig.7a, c, p.117, fig.8, p.118, fig.9-10)
